intro: Bunochilus scapulus, commonly known as the scapular bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has slender, branching stems. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, often with a hairy texture. The flowers bloom in summer and are pollinated primarily by insects.
